title: Ironically, Yasuos only weakness is...
body:
Yasuos only weakness is the fact that he has no weakness.
It gives the player a false sense of godliness that baits them into repeatedly 1v5ing.
Fortunately enough for the Yasuo player, Yasuo is so broken, that this type of suicidal, bronze behavior,actually wins games in the end. Even if he goes 0-10 in the first 20mins.
Because the balance team knows what theyre doing.

A stunned Leona has probably already ulted and used all her spells, at which point she's in the middle of the enemy team with Aftershock and W going. She wasn't going to take anymore actions anyway. Now her team has to follow up and hopefully get things done before she dies. She makes that window as long as possible by using defensive spells and items.

A champion like Yasuo or Kat is balanced around continually attacking, casting, and moving in order to deal damage and avoid taking damage (which they can't easily handle due to low defenses). Stunning such a champion makes their effectiveness plummet along with their chances for survival.

Hard CC can be applied to everyone, and targets are almost always affected by it except in rare cases like Unstoppable, spell shields, Black Shield, or Ragnarök. This much is true.

But it doesn't always have the desired effect of preventing the target from fulfilling their role. This is why "just CC them" is a reasonable answer on how to counter Yi, Yasuo, Kat, and other squishy champs who rely on continuous movement and action, while not being a reasonable answer on how to counter Malph, Garen, and other durable champs who cast a few abilities and then stand around.

This is similar to e.g. magic damage vs physical damage. "Use magic damage" is better advice for killing Malphite or Rammus than it is for killing Galio, even though you can apply magic damage to all champions and it'll have some kind of effect unless the target is invulnerable at the time.
